headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Jordan 88 (101b 7x4 0x6 152m) SR: 87.12

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, through the gate, Dilshan goes! He was closing in on a first hundred in England, had mixed care with aggression but he's been done by a perfect length from Jordan, lured him forward and the ball tailed in between bat and pad, thunking into the top of middle to ping the bails. Slightly loose from Dilshan but Jordan has done really well to fox a man who's hung in there for 100 deliveries

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan c Morgan b Anderson 43 (33b 2x4 2x6 51m) SR: 130.3

dismissalComment.html: slower-ball bouncer and Priyanjan top-edges to mid-on! Been a fiesty little knock but he was duped there, through the shot a little early trying to drag a pull over midwicket, it looped up softly to Morgan, who pockets it nonchalantly. That's Anderson's 250th ODI wicket and England will hope it finally puts the brakes on the SL innings

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: throws the bat again, this time picking out cover with a mistimed drive! May have been another change of pace, Gurney was bowling around the wicket and Mathews wanted to go inside out over cover, didn't get enough on it and this time a simple catch is taken simply

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pitched up and slapped to cover! Not enough elevation as Chandimal looked for the ropes again, skewered his drive straight to Bopara, who takes his second catch to help atone for dropping Mathews
Kulasekara clears the front leg and clouts the ball high towards cow corner... but there's a man out there and he's gone too! Third wicket for Gurney, Sri Lanka stumbling towards 250

pushes and nicks to second slip, Thirimanne's vigil is over! He had been patient, oh so patient, but England were working him hard, this he could have left, slightly back of a length and in the channel but the hands were drawn to it and a lick of flame singed the outside edge, sizeable deflection and a safe take from Tredwell

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: slower-ball bouncer and Priyanjan top-edges to mid-on! Been a fiesty little knock but he was duped there, through the shot a little early trying to drag a pull over midwicket, it looped up softly to Morgan, who pockets it nonchalantly. That's Anderson's 250th ODI wicket and England will hope it finally puts the brakes on the SL innings

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Tredwell b Anderson 10 (37b 0x4 1x6 35m) SR: 27.02

dismissalComment.html: pushes and nicks to second slip, Thirimanne's vigil is over! He had been patient, oh so patient, but England were working him hard, this he could have left, slightly back of a length and in the channel but the hands were drawn to it and a lick of flame singed the outside edge, sizeable deflection and a safe take from Tredwell

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c †Buttler b Tredwell 40 (67b 2x4 0x6 83m) SR: 59.7

dismissalComment.html: beautifully slow delivery from Tredwell and Sanga goes, trying to force it over the leg side. This is pitched outside off, turning away, and Sanga gets on his kneees and tries to slog it against the turn. The result is a top edge that goes almost straight up. Jos Buttler calls for it, settles nicely beneath it and pouches the ball. Good breakthrough. Tredwell deserves it for his bravery.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Ballance/†Buttler) 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slightly quicker again, but shorter and wider. Dilshan cuts it away behind square and Ballance hares after it, pulling it in nicely and letting fly with the throw. But what's this? It might be a run out. Mahela's coming back for the third and England may have caught him short. I think there was a bit of complacency there from Mahela, who didn't bother diving. England weren't that excited about it, but he's at least a few inches out. Double blow for Sri Lanka.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Jordan 88 (101b 7x4 0x6 152m) SR: 87.12

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, through the gate, Dilshan goes! He was closing in on a first hundred in England, had mixed care with aggression but he's been done by a perfect length from Jordan, lured him forward and the ball tailed in between bat and pad, thunking into the top of middle to ping the bails. Slightly loose from Dilshan but Jordan has done really well to fox a man who's hung in there for 100 deliveries

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Bopara b Gurney 14 (9b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 155.55

dismissalComment.html: pitched up and slapped to cover! Not enough elevation as Chandimal looked for the ropes again, skewered his drive straight to Bopara, who takes his second catch to help atone for dropping Mathews

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Root b Gurney 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Kulasekara clears the front leg and clouts the ball high towards cow corner... but there's a man out there and he's gone too! Third wicket for Gurney, Sri Lanka stumbling towards 250

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Chandimal b Prasad 40 (58b 3x4 2x6 85m) SR: 68.96

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, pulled hard, good timing but Morgan has perfectly picked out deep midwicket who holds a solid catch. Morgan was understandably swinging at anything in his zone and he made a great connection but couldn't keep it down or indeed get the direction right

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 12 (17b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 70.58

dismissalComment.html: nice use of the variation from Kulasekara. This is the one that straightens down the line a tad. It doesn't do a lot, but Bell is expecting this wide, back of a length ball to seam in as they usually do, and ends up giving a thick edge to Sangakkara. Kula hasn't got his lines right, but he's got two nonetheless.

bowled him! Completely foxes him in the flight, Bopara pushes at this one, as it pitches outside off. Doesn't account for the turn or the bounce that Senanayake gets, and the ball beats the inside edge and strikes off stump. England in further disarray. Think that was the one that moves off the seam. Bopara was caught in two minds whether to come forward or back.

sharp offspin, Jordan caught on the crease and given out lbw was it doing too much? Jordan goes for the review. He's right back on the stumps and hit in line with middle and Hawk Eye has it smashing leg stump so a second good decision from umpire Erasmus in the innings and England slide further. He can biff the seamers but a different kettle of fish against spin for Jordan

tossed up just outside off and Tredwell lifts it up and down the ground and straight into the hands of long-off. What a funny shot. I assumed it was a calm chip for a couple over the in-field but Tredwell has just knocked it nicely to the fielder coming in a few yards. Bizarre. Terrible stroke

a charge down the wicket, wild swing having got nowhere near the pitch of the ball and Anderson is bowled and England have been routed here. A pretty ugly ending with a miserable shot from Anderson to lose his off stump. Completes an excellent spell from Senanayake, his fourth wicket

headshotImage.caption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Carberry's stay is a short one. Classic Kulasekara dismissal of a left-hander. Pitches it on middle and off, wobbles it away. Carberry gets a thin but audible edge as he prods on the front foot, and Sangakkara collects at around knee height. Sri Lanka have their first.

nice use of the variation from Kulasekara. This is the one that straightens down the line a tad. It doesn't do a lot, but Bell is expecting this wide, back of a length ball to seam in as they usually do, and ends up giving a thick edge to Sangakkara. Kula hasn't got his lines right, but he's got two nonetheless.

another one for Kulasekara, and I think this is the one that straightens again. This is angled across Ballance, who expects it to jag away when it pitches on a length, but it seams the other way - not a lot, but enough to beat the bat and strike the front pad. That would have gone on to hit off stump. The umpire raises his finger. Ballance doesn't bother reviewing. Seam has got the England top order in tatters

headshotImage.caption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Carberry c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 6 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: gone! Carberry's stay is a short one. Classic Kulasekara dismissal of a left-hander. Pitches it on middle and off, wobbles it away. Carberry gets a thin but audible edge as he prods on the front foot, and Sangakkara collects at around knee height. Sri Lanka have their first.

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 12 (17b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 70.58

dismissalComment.html: nice use of the variation from Kulasekara. This is the one that straightens down the line a tad. It doesn't do a lot, but Bell is expecting this wide, back of a length ball to seam in as they usually do, and ends up giving a thick edge to Sangakkara. Kula hasn't got his lines right, but he's got two nonetheless.

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root b Malinga 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: OH! And that's completely done Root in. The batsman misjudges the length completely, stays back to a length ball he could have come forward to, and what's more, played down the wrong line to a ball that seamed away. Root plays too straight and Malinga cleans up the off stump. England in a state early on.

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Ballance lbw b Kulasekara 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: another one for Kulasekara, and I think this is the one that straightens again. This is angled across Ballance, who expects it to jag away when it pitches on a length, but it seams the other way - not a lot, but enough to beat the bat and strike the front pad. That would have gone on to hit off stump. The umpire raises his finger. Ballance doesn't bother reviewing. Seam has got the England top order in tatters

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara b Senanayake 7 (24b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 29.16

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Completely foxes him in the flight, Bopara pushes at this one, as it pitches outside off. Doesn't account for the turn or the bounce that Senanayake gets, and the ball beats the inside edge and strikes off stump. England in further disarray. Think that was the one that moves off the seam. Bopara was caught in two minds whether to come forward or back.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler c Senanayake b Mathews 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Oh geez, what's happened there? That one looks like it stopped on Buttler, but Mathews does do that sometimes. It's a fairly average ball otherwise, and Buttler will be annoyed by that. It's short of a length, about a foot outside off. The batsman looks to drag it to leg, but is fooled by the lack of pace. In the end, all he does is bunt it up gently in the air to the off side, where Senanayake at short cover dives to his side and snaffles it.

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan lbw b Senanayake 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: sharp offspin, Jordan caught on the crease and given out lbw was it doing too much? Jordan goes for the review. He's right back on the stumps and hit in line with middle and Hawk Eye has it smashing leg stump so a second good decision from umpire Erasmus in the innings and England slide further. He can biff the seamers but a different kettle of fish against spin for Jordan

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell c Kulasekara b Senanayake 4 (14b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: tossed up just outside off and Tredwell lifts it up and down the ground and straight into the hands of long-off. What a funny shot. I assumed it was a calm chip for a couple over the in-field but Tredwell has just knocked it nicely to the fielder coming in a few yards. Bizarre. Terrible stroke

headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Chandimal b Prasad 40 (58b 3x4 2x6 85m) SR: 68.96

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, pulled hard, good timing but Morgan has perfectly picked out deep midwicket who holds a solid catch. Morgan was understandably swinging at anything in his zone and he made a great connection but couldn't keep it down or indeed get the direction right

dismissalText.commentary: James Anderson b Senanayake 7 (14b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: a charge down the wicket, wild swing having got nowhere near the pitch of the ball and Anderson is bowled and England have been routed here. A pretty ugly ending with a miserable shot from Anderson to lose his off stump. Completes an excellent spell from Senanayake, his fourth wicket

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Anderson b Senanayake 7 (14b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 50

commentTextItems.html: a charge down the wicket, wild swing having got nowhere near the pitch of the ball and Anderson is bowled and England have been routed here. A pretty ugly ending with a miserable shot from Anderson to lose his off stump. Completes an excellent spell from Senanayake, his fourth wicket

commentPostTextItems.html: It's the Sri Lankan fans singing in the north-east, they are level in this five-match series with the next rubber coming up on Wednesday at Old Trafford, 1pm BST start for that one, see you then...

Here's the Presentation. What is Eoin Morgan going to make of this: "Abysmal really, we lacked partnerships and never really got anything going. I can't explain it. It did a little bit. We talked about a partnership of substance but it wasn't there. We talked about getting through the first 10 overs but lost wickets consistently and underperformed massively. We've been outplayed in conditions we normally thrive on. We don't drop too many catches in training but again we were a little bit sloppy in the field."

Angelo Mathews: "It was a pleasing performance on a sporty wicket. The batters had to work really hard but Dilshan played outstandingly well. We were not really sure at half-time but the bowlers were great, very aggressive. The conditions were a challenge for our team, it was cold out there. Kulasekera is unplayable in these conditions and Senanayake has a lot of confidence and was outstanding once again."
Tillakaratne Dilshan is Man of the Match not for his ear-warmers when fielding but for his fine 88 that set the match up for Sri Lanka.

England would probably have been fairly pleased at lunch with a handy bowling performance to ensure Sri Lanka didn't run away from them, although more drop catches and plenty of wides were a further sign of slipperiness. But that batting performance was an absolute shocker. It wobbled with the new ball but there was nothing excessive. Nor was their an abundance of help for the spinner and yet England were tripped up.

Good heavens, England have been obliterated. The Oval was merely a ray of light among the storm clouds which have swarmed over them again in the north-east. An absolute hammering by 157 runs with their sixth-lowest ODI score. No-one expected that at half-time but after wickets with the new ball, Senanayake took over to rip through the lower-middle order and Sri Lanka have levelled the series in some style here.

commentTextItems.html: a step to leg, the bowler follows the batsman who tries an awkward pull and gets a thick bottom edge that runs wide of the diving Sangakkara

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: another swing and miss, this time sort of aiming leg side to a similar ball
short again, Gurney this time swings and misses
back of a length on the stumps, Gurney steps inside it and allows it to pass

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Chandimal b Prasad 40 (58b 3x4 2x6 85m) SR: 68.96

commentTextItems.html: back of a length, pulled hard, good timing but Morgan has perfectly picked out deep midwicket who holds a solid catch. Morgan was understandably swinging at anything in his zone and he made a great connection but couldn't keep it down or indeed get the direction right

commentPostTextItems.html: So last rites for England. Quiet contemplation is going to be needed after this...

commentTextItems.html: full and wide down leg
bumper, pulled, wild top edge and it flies all the way for six over long leg and England do indeed avoid their lowest ODI total
forward just blocking once again
forward blocked on the stumps
full delivery, goes reverse again and this time creams it backward of point, top timing
waited for and cut from just outside off to cover point
pushed on the back foot back to the bowler
reverse swept from just outside off, audacious from Anderson, he missed
full length angled across Morgan who drives beautifully up and over mid-off and he's nailed it all the way for six, superb timing and England now might avoid their lowest score
short again, this at the body, fended off awarkdly down to long leg
touch shorter and whistles past Anderson's shoulder, he just about got the bat inside the line
back of a length and tucked to square leg
touch more leg side and clipped for a single through midwicket
full and straight, driven back to the bowler who fumbles before mid-on cleans up

He was closing in on a first hundred in England, had mixed care with aggression but he's been done by a perfect length from Jordan, lured him forward and the ball tailed in between bat and pad, thunking into the top of middle to ping the bails. Slightly loose from Dilshan but Jordan has done really well to fox a man who's hung in there for 100 deliveries

beautifully slow delivery from Tredwell and Sanga goes, trying to force it over the leg side. This is pitched outside off, turning away, and Sanga gets on his kneees and tries to slog it against the turn. The result is a top edge that goes almost straight up. Jos Buttler calls for it, settles nicely beneath it and pouches the ball. Good breakthrough. Tredwell deserves it for his bravery.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne c Tredwell b Anderson 10 (37b 0x4 1x6 35m) SR: 27.02

dismissalComment.html: pushes and nicks to second slip, Thirimanne's vigil is over! He had been patient, oh so patient, but England were working him hard, this he could have left, slightly back of a length and in the channel but the hands were drawn to it and a lick of flame singed the outside edge, sizeable deflection and a safe take from Tredwell

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c †Buttler b Tredwell 40 (67b 2x4 0x6 83m) SR: 59.7

dismissalComment.html: beautifully slow delivery from Tredwell and Sanga goes, trying to force it over the leg side. This is pitched outside off, turning away, and Sanga gets on his kneees and tries to slog it against the turn. The result is a top edge that goes almost straight up. Jos Buttler calls for it, settles nicely beneath it and pouches the ball. Good breakthrough. Tredwell deserves it for his bravery.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene run out (Ballance/†Buttler) 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slightly quicker again, but shorter and wider. Dilshan cuts it away behind square and Ballance hares after it, pulling it in nicely and letting fly with the throw. But what's this? It might be a run out. Mahela's coming back for the third and England may have caught him short. I think there was a bit of complacency there from Mahela, who didn't bother diving. England weren't that excited about it, but he's at least a few inches out. Double blow for Sri Lanka.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Jordan 88 (101b 7x4 0x6 152m) SR: 87.12

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, through the gate, Dilshan goes! He was closing in on a first hundred in England, had mixed care with aggression but he's been done by a perfect length from Jordan, lured him forward and the ball tailed in between bat and pad, thunking into the top of middle to ping the bails. Slightly loose from Dilshan but Jordan has done really well to fox a man who's hung in there for 100 deliveries

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Bopara b Gurney 30 (35b 2x4 0x6 66m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: throws the bat again, this time picking out cover with a mistimed drive! May have been another change of pace, Gurney was bowling around the wicket and Mathews wanted to go inside out over cover, didn't get enough on it and this time a simple catch is taken simply

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan c Morgan b Anderson 43 (33b 2x4 2x6 51m) SR: 130.3

dismissalComment.html: slower-ball bouncer and Priyanjan top-edges to mid-on! Been a fiesty little knock but he was duped there, through the shot a little early trying to drag a pull over midwicket, it looped up softly to Morgan, who pockets it nonchalantly. That's Anderson's 250th ODI wicket and England will hope it finally puts the brakes on the SL innings

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Bopara b Gurney 14 (9b 2x4 0x6 11m) SR: 155.55

dismissalComment.html: pitched up and slapped to cover! Not enough elevation as Chandimal looked for the ropes again, skewered his drive straight to Bopara, who takes his second catch to help atone for dropping Mathews

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c Root b Gurney 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Kulasekara clears the front leg and clouts the ball high towards cow corner... but there's a man out there and he's gone too! Third wicket for Gurney, Sri Lanka stumbling towards 250

headshotImage.caption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Michael Carberry player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Michael Carberry c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 6 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: gone! Carberry's stay is a short one. Classic Kulasekara dismissal of a left-hander. Pitches it on middle and off, wobbles it away. Carberry gets a thin but audible edge as he prods on the front foot, and Sangakkara collects at around knee height. Sri Lanka have their first.

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 12 (17b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 70.58

dismissalComment.html: nice use of the variation from Kulasekara. This is the one that straightens down the line a tad. It doesn't do a lot, but Bell is expecting this wide, back of a length ball to seam in as they usually do, and ends up giving a thick edge to Sangakkara. Kula hasn't got his lines right, but he's got two nonetheless.

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Ballance lbw b Kulasekara 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: another one for Kulasekara, and I think this is the one that straightens again. This is angled across Ballance, who expects it to jag away when it pitches on a length, but it seams the other way - not a lot, but enough to beat the bat and strike the front pad. That would have gone on to hit off stump. The umpire raises his finger. Ballance doesn't bother reviewing. Seam has got the England top order in tatters

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root b Malinga 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: OH! And that's completely done Root in. The batsman misjudges the length completely, stays back to a length ball he could have come forward to, and what's more, played down the wrong line to a ball that seamed away. Root plays too straight and Malinga cleans up the off stump. England in a state early on.

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c Chandimal b Prasad 40 (58b 3x4 2x6 85m) SR: 68.96

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, pulled hard, good timing but Morgan has perfectly picked out deep midwicket who holds a solid catch. Morgan was understandably swinging at anything in his zone and he made a great connection but couldn't keep it down or indeed get the direction right

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara b Senanayake 7 (24b 1x4 0x6 36m) SR: 29.16

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Completely foxes him in the flight, Bopara pushes at this one, as it pitches outside off. Doesn't account for the turn or the bounce that Senanayake gets, and the ball beats the inside edge and strikes off stump. England in further disarray. Think that was the one that moves off the seam. Bopara was caught in two minds whether to come forward or back.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler c Senanayake b Mathews 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Oh geez, what's happened there? That one looks like it stopped on Buttler, but Mathews does do that sometimes. It's a fairly average ball otherwise, and Buttler will be annoyed by that. It's short of a length, about a foot outside off. The batsman looks to drag it to leg, but is fooled by the lack of pace. In the end, all he does is bunt it up gently in the air to the off side, where Senanayake at short cover dives to his side and snaffles it.

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Jordan lbw b Senanayake 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: sharp offspin, Jordan caught on the crease and given out lbw was it doing too much? Jordan goes for the review. He's right back on the stumps and hit in line with middle and Hawk Eye has it smashing leg stump so a second good decision from umpire Erasmus in the innings and England slide further. He can biff the seamers but a different kettle of fish against spin for Jordan

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell c Kulasekara b Senanayake 4 (14b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: tossed up just outside off and Tredwell lifts it up and down the ground and straight into the hands of long-off. What a funny shot. I assumed it was a calm chip for a couple over the in-field but Tredwell has just knocked it nicely to the fielder coming in a few yards. Bizarre. Terrible stroke

dismissalText.commentary: James Anderson b Senanayake 7 (14b 1x4 0x6 17m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: a charge down the wicket, wild swing having got nowhere near the pitch of the ball and Anderson is bowled and England have been routed here. A pretty ugly ending with a miserable shot from Anderson to lose his off stump. Completes an excellent spell from Senanayake, his fourth wicket

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Gurney not out 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 34 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 13.4 overs (82 balls), Extras 10
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 63/1 in 16.0 overs (TM Dilshan 33, KC Sangakkara 10)
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 77 balls (TM Dilshan 23, KC Sangakkara 22, Ex 5)
TM Dilshan: 50 off 63 balls (4 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 24.3 overs (147 balls), Extras 10
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 145/3 in 35.0 overs (TM Dilshan 79, AD Mathews 2)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 35.5 overs (215 balls), Extras 14
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 43.1 overs (259 balls), Extras 17
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 41 balls (AD Mathews 20, SMA Priyanjan 27, Ex 3)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 49.1 overs (295 balls), Extras 20
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 256/8 in 50.0 overs (SMSM Senanayake 2, KTGD Prasad 7)
England innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 31 runs, 4 wickets)
England: 50 runs in 15.4 overs (95 balls), Extras 6
Over 18.2: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - M Erasmus, Batsman - CJ Jordan (Struck down)

milestones.description: Ian Bell has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ENG breaking Pietersen's record

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014

stories.title: A crossroads for Joe Root
stories.seoTitle: Jon Hotten: A crossroads for Joe Root
stories.summary: Long hailed for his extraordinary talent, Root is still to quite make good. And England can't afford to give him the time they gave a young Ian Bell to blossom

image.caption: Joe Root miscues a sweep off Nathan Lyon
image.longCaption: Joe Root miscues a sweep off Nathan Lyon, Australia v England, 2nd Test, Adelaide, 3rd day, December 7, 2013

stories.title: England defeat 'embarrassing' - Root
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka in England 2014
stories.summary: Joe Root has admitted that England's 157-run defeat to Sri Lanka in the second ODI was "embarrassing" and said improved performances are required to keep the paying public interested

image.caption: James Anderson was bowled to be last man out
image.longCaption: James Anderson was bowled to be last man out, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Dilshan dimmed by time but grows in substance
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Fernando: Tillakaratne Dilshan dimmed by time but grows in substance
stories.summary: The one-time master of a vast arsenal of strokes has smelted down his technique as age catches up with him. How he and his side have benefited

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan had to rein in his attacking instincts
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan had to rein in his attacking instincts, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Morgan condemns 'worst' England display
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.summary: Eoin Morgan was at a loss to explain England's humbling defeat at Chester-le-Street, terming it "one of the worst performances I've been a part of in an England shirt"

image.caption: Nuwan Kulasekara had Ian Bell caught behind
image.longCaption: Nuwan Kulasekara had Ian Bell caught behind, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Jordan beauty keeps Dilshan waiting
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Chris Jordan beauty keeps Tillakaratne Dilshan waiting
stories.summary: ESPNcricinfo presents the plays of the day from Chester-le-Street

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was bowled through the gate for 88
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was bowled through the gate for 88, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Injured Lakmal out of ODI series
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka in England 2014
stories.seoTitle: Injured Suranga Lakmal out of ODI series
stories.summary: Fast bowler Suranga Lakmal has been ruled out of the remaining ODIs against England, after sustaining a grade-two tear on his right hamstring in the first ODI

image.caption: Suranga Lakmal had Joe Root caught down the leg side
image.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal had Joe Root caught down the leg side, England v Sri Lanka, T20, The Oval, May 20, 2014

stories.title: Sri Lanka skittle England for 99 in huge win
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka skittle England for 99 in huge win
stories.summary: Sri Lanka skittled England for a paltry 99, as Nuwan Kulasekara knocked off the top order and Sachithra Senanayake improved his career-best for the second match running, to secure a crushing 157-run victory
stories.byline: The Report by Andrew McGlashan at Chester-le-Street

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was the only Sri Lanka player to pass fifty
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was the only Sri Lanka player to pass fifty, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Atapattu backs Sri Lanka's fighting spirit
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Atapattu backs Sri Lanka's fighting spirit
stories.summary: Marvan Atapattu, Sri Lanka's interim coach, has backed his team to come out firing in the second one-day international against England as they attempt to level the series

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan slapped his way to 33 but took 40 balls to do so
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan slapped his way to 33 but took 40 balls to do so, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, May 22, 2014

stories.title: Hales called up with Cook in doubt
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Alex Hales called up with Alastair Cook in doubt
stories.summary: Alex Hales, the Nottinghamshire batsman, has been added to the England squad for the second ODI against Sri Lanka at Chester-le-Street as cover for captain Alastair Cook.

image.caption: Alex Hales was hoping to reproduce his T20 success against Sri Lanka
image.longCaption: Alex Hales was hoping to reproduce his T20 success against Sri Lanka, England v Sri Lanka, T20, The Oval, May 20, 2014

stories.title: Resurgent England wary of backlash
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.summary: England put behind a terrible six months with success in the first ODI when they they dominated Sri Lanka's attack. The visitors have the experience to recover, though
stories.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Gary Ballance went to his second ODI half-century
image.longCaption: Gary Ballance went to his second ODI half-century, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, May 22, 2014

stories.title: Back Ballance for top bat at 4/1
stories.seoTitle: Back Gary Ballance for top bat at 4/1

videos.title: Sri Lanka surge back into series
videos.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
videos.seoTitle: Sri Lanka surge back into series
videos.summary: Andrew McGlashan reports from Chester-le-Street where England were blown away for 99 by Sri Lanka

galleries.title: Sri Lanka rout England to level series

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014

stories.title: A crossroads for Joe Root
stories.seoTitle: Jon Hotten: A crossroads for Joe Root
stories.summary: Long hailed for his extraordinary talent, Root is still to quite make good. And England can't afford to give him the time they gave a young Ian Bell to blossom

image.caption: Joe Root miscues a sweep off Nathan Lyon
image.longCaption: Joe Root miscues a sweep off Nathan Lyon, Australia v England, 2nd Test, Adelaide, 3rd day, December 7, 2013

stories.title: England defeat 'embarrassing' - Root
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka in England 2014
stories.summary: Joe Root has admitted that England's 157-run defeat to Sri Lanka in the second ODI was "embarrassing" and said improved performances are required to keep the paying public interested

image.caption: James Anderson was bowled to be last man out
image.longCaption: James Anderson was bowled to be last man out, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Dilshan dimmed by time but grows in substance
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.seoTitle: Fernando: Tillakaratne Dilshan dimmed by time but grows in substance
stories.summary: The one-time master of a vast arsenal of strokes has smelted down his technique as age catches up with him. How he and his side have benefited

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan had to rein in his attacking instincts
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan had to rein in his attacking instincts, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

stories.title: Morgan condemns 'worst' England display
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
stories.summary: Eoin Morgan was at a loss to explain England's humbling defeat at Chester-le-Street, terming it "one of the worst performances I've been a part of in an England shirt"

image.caption: Nuwan Kulasekara had Ian Bell caught behind
image.longCaption: Nuwan Kulasekara had Ian Bell caught behind, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

videos.title: Sri Lanka surge back into series
videos.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
videos.seoTitle: Sri Lanka surge back into series
videos.summary: Andrew McGlashan reports from Chester-le-Street where England were blown away for 99 by Sri Lanka

videos.title: WATCHESPN: 2nd ODI: England v Sri Lanka at Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

recentReportStory.title: Sri Lanka skittle England for 99 in huge win
recentReportStory.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Sri Lanka skittle England for 99 in huge win
recentReportStory.summary: Sri Lanka skittled England for a paltry 99, as Nuwan Kulasekara knocked off the top order and Sachithra Senanayake improved his career-best for the second match running, to secure a crushing 157-run victory
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Andrew McGlashan at Chester-le-Street

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was the only Sri Lanka player to pass fifty
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan was the only Sri Lanka player to pass fifty, England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street, May 25, 2014

recentReportStory.credit: Andrew McGlashan is an assistant editor at ESPNcricinfo

recentPreviewStory.title: Resurgent England wary of backlash
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Chester-le-Street
recentPreviewStory.summary: England put behind a terrible six months with success in the first ODI when they they dominated Sri Lanka's attack. The visitors have the experience to recover, though
recentPreviewStory.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando

image.caption: Gary Ballance went to his second ODI half-century
image.longCaption: Gary Ballance went to his second ODI half-century, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, May 22, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Andrew Fidel Fernando is ESPNcricinfo's Sri Lanka correspondent. @andrewffernando
